page.title: 05LOCAL AGRICULTURE 2
page.content: Lassington Court and Astman's Farm lie north of Highnam. Astman's was in the original Domesday Book and is today a dairy farm. In recent years Lassington Court has changed to specialise in dairying also.Both farms rely on family labour;three generations working at Lassington, whilst at Astman's the problem of labour has resulted in the farmer adjusting his operation and acreage to match his own desired workload. Such operational changes reflect responses to the changing economic climate but may leave recent buildings and equipment unused or underused.
